name: cheerfully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 in a happy and positive way: She walked down the road, whistling cheerfully. "Hello, Mrs Morris!" he exclaimed cheerfully.
in a way that is bright and pleasant and makes you feel positive and happy: The classrooms were cheerfully decorated with children's artwork. The playroom is cheerfully bright and sunny.
UK humorous without worrying or feeling sad or sorry about something: By the end of the evening I could cheerfully have punched him. They cheerfully admit that their research may have little practical value. See
cheerful
More examplesFewer examplesMrs Smith worked cheerfully beside the others.There were no cheerfully gaudy costumes.To that charge, he cheerfully pleads guilty.
